Function reference

The Max Step

Functions and objects for performing the Max step of the Max & Smooth algorithm

ms_max()
Max step of Max-and-Smooth
fit_gev_trend()
A function to calculate and return parameters and Hessian for the generalized extreme distribution with trend
neg_log_lik_gev_trend()
Calculate the negative log likelihood of a generalized extreme value distribution with trend using vague priors on the parameters

ms_max()
Max step of Max-and-Smooth
ms_smooth()
Perform the second step, smooth, to sample from the posterior
ms_smooth_sample()
Helper function for performing sampling
neg_log_lik_gev_trend()
Calculate the negative log likelihood of a generalized extreme value distribution with trend using vague priors on the parameters
pi_etahat_cond_x_theta()
Log density of y given x and theta
pi_theta()
Log prior for Theta
pi_theta_cond_etahat()
The log density of Theta conditioned on all other parameters
pi_x_cond_theta()
The log density of x conditioned on theta
pi_x_cond_theta_etahat()
Log density of x conditioned on etahat and theta

tidy_helper()
Function to be applied to each chain's results and reduced into one data frame
tidy_results()
Take the raw results from the MCMC sampler and convert it to a tidy draws_df object
update_theta()
A function to perform a metropolis hastings step on the proposed theta vector
